results.content:
If you are in need of learning and fully understanding Promises from the inside out, then this course is fine.

The content is good, and the lectures give good in-depth explanation, and examples.

I personally got what I needed from this one.

That being said, several resources are outdated, and it is left to the students to fix this in every single lecture file, instead of the publisher updating the code.

Additionally, there are no assignments/exercises for the students, and I think any course should have it, if possible.

I have also noticed that several Q&As have been left unanswered, something that will frustrate students.

Like I said, a fine course for learning Promises, but there are several bumps on the road. Needs improvement and better follow-up.

results.content: I enjoyed this course; it goes in depth with the issue of Promises. Videos are short, clear and focused on real world use cases an examples. I recommend this course for anyone wanting to get a good background on Promises.
results.content_html: I enjoyed this course; it goes in depth with the issue of Promises. Videos are short, clear and focused on real world use cases an examples. I recommend this course for anyone wanting to get a good background on Promises.

results.content:
Very thorough, really helped me understand promises in a deeper level.
Though I think that the examples contain too much noise about irrelevant apis and could be "cleaner"
results.content_html:
Very thorough, really helped me understand promises in a deeper level.
Though I think that the examples contain too much noise about irrelevant apis and could be "cleaner"

results.content: Very informative.  I think actual implementation examples could be simplified to less complicated "example scripts with console.log()" vs the overhead required to provide Angular and GUI examples.  But in general, if learning about Promises is your aim, this course will do it.  Its just the examples given to work with will slow you down if you aren't a JS/HTML/Angular day-to-day pro.
results.content_html: Very informative. I think actual implementation examples could be simplified to less complicated "example scripts with console.log()" vs the overhead required to provide Angular and GUI examples. But in general, if learning about Promises is your aim, this course will do it. Its just the examples given to work with will slow you down if you aren't a JS/HTML/Angular day-to-day pro.

results.content:
- Very well explained
- Short (time saving!)
- Many different real life examples
- Deep dive into Promises
- For at least competent/proficient devs: does not include basic JS topics

results.content:
Good course. 
Provided lots of useful examples and information.
The instructor explains all steps given in a very understandable way and the resources are complete and adequate
results.content_html:
Good course.
Provided lots of useful examples and information.

results.content: I wish I could give this course even more than 5 stars.  I need to get up to speed with Promises in NodeJS and AngularJS quickly for my job and this course has cleared up a lot of my misconceptions.  The code examples are brilliant and well explained.   Even if I have to watch more than once to completely understand, I feel like there is great value in seeing well written code like this, instead of over simplified examples.
results.content_html: I wish I could give this course even more than 5 stars. I need to get up to speed with Promises in NodeJS and AngularJS quickly for my job and this course has cleared up a lot of my misconceptions. The code examples are brilliant and well explained. Even if I have to watch more than once to completely understand, I feel like there is great value in seeing well written code like this, instead of over simplified examples.

results.content:
This course presents a very clear path in building a robust knowledge about promises in javascript.

Content is clear, explanations precise and the code in it is very relevant. The trainer english is quite good. Pace is ideal for learning.

I highly recommend this course for someone wanting to clearly understand promises and all use cases that go with it, to become a powerful asynchronous programmer.
results.content_html:
This course presents a very clear path in building a robust knowledge about promises in javascript.

Content is clear, explanations precise and the code in it is very relevant. The trainer english is quite good. Pace is ideal for learning.

I highly recommend this course for someone wanting to clearly understand promises and all use cases that go with it, to become a powerful asynchronous programmer.

results.content: Topics covered too fast. Compare with Anthony Alicea's courses which are slower paced and allow the student time to understand and internalize the information.
results.content_html: Topics covered too fast. Compare with Anthony Alicea's courses which are slower paced and allow the student time to understand and internalize the information.

results.content: Student questions go unresolved for +1 yr in the Q&A section (just repeated assurances by Packt that they will look into the issue, with no further update). The course itself is alright, but not super helpful if you have no prior knowledge of promises. The instructor is certainly knowledgeable, but wish he would go deeper into the fundamentals
